title: Front Forks - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency causing loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Note the routing of the ABS wheel speed sensor harness and its locating clips for installation.
There is a shim between the ABS wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing and detach the ABS wheel speed sensor from the left hand fork leg, collect the shim.
Note the orientation and position of the direction indicators on the forks for installation.
Loosen the upper yoke clamp fixings.
If the forks are to be dismantled, loosen the fork top caps.
Remove the direction indicator bracket pinch bolt.
Remove the lower yoke pinch bolt and slide the fork down through the yokes. Discard the pinch bolt.
As the fork is released, slide the direction indicator brackets off the fork and tie aside. Do not allow the direction indicators to hang on the wiring harnesses.
Remove the forks from the lower yoke.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency causing loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Perform the following operations:
Front Wheel - Removal
Front Mudguard - Removal

There is a shim between the ABS wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing and detach the ABS wheel speed sensor from the left hand fork leg, collect the shim.

Note the orientation and position of the direction indicators on the forks for installation.

If the forks are to be dismantled, loosen the fork top caps.
Remove the direction indicator bracket pinch bolt.

Upper yoke
Fixing
Direction indicator
Remove the lower yoke pinch bolt and slide the fork down through the yokes. Discard the pinch bolt.
Fixings
As the fork is released, slide the direction indicator brackets off the fork and tie aside. Do not allow the direction indicators to hang on the wiring harnesses.
Remove the forks from the lower yoke.
